## Custo Relativo e Custo de Oportunidade üí∞ {.smaller}

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Taxa Marginal de Transforma√ß√£o:**

$$TMT_{Y,X} = -\frac{\Delta Y}{\Delta X}$$

<div style="font-size: 0.8em;">

| Possibilidade | Bem X | Bem Y | $TMT_{Y,X}$ |
|:-------------:|:-----:|:-----:|:-----------:|
| A | 0 | 30 | ‚Äî |
| B | 2 | 28 | 1 |
| C | 4 | 24 | 2 |
| D | 6 | 18 | 3 |
| E | 8 | 10 | 4 |
| F | 10 | 0 | 5 |

</div>
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: {.fragment}
```{r}

#| fig-width: 5
```

## Custo Relativo como Derivada da FPP üìê

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| fig-width: 5
#| fig-height: 5

library(ggplot2)

x_smooth <- seq(0, 10, length.out = 100)
y_smooth <- 30 - (x_smooth^2)/3

# Pontos A e B para a secante
xa <- 2.3
xb <- 7.7
ya <- 30 - (xa^2)/3
yb <- 30 - (xb^2)/3

# Ponto C (meio) para a tangente
xc <- 5
yc <- 30 - (xc^2)/3
# Derivada: dy/dx = -2x/3
slope_c <- -2*xc/3
# Equa√ß√£o da tangente: y - yc = slope_c*(x - xc)
x_tang <- seq(2, 8, length.out = 100)
y_tang <- yc + slope_c*(x_tang - xc)

df <- data.frame(x = x_smooth, y = y_smooth)

ggplot() +
  geom_line(data = df, aes(x = x, y = y), 
           color = "#003D7A", size = 1.2) +
  # Secante AB
  geom_segment(aes(x = xa, xend = xb, y = ya, yend = yb),
              color = "#0066CC", size = 1, linetype = "dashed") +
  # Tangente em C
  geom_line(data = data.frame(x = x_tang, y = y_tang),
           aes(x = x, y = y), color = "#FF0000", size = 1) +
  # Pontos
  geom_point(aes(x = xa, y = ya), color = "#0066CC", size = 3) +
  geom_point(aes(x = xb, y = yb), color = "#0066CC", size = 3) +
  geom_point(aes(x = xc, y = yc), color = "#FF0000", size = 4) +
  # Labels
  annotate("text", x = xa, y = ya, label = "A", 
          vjust = -1, hjust = 1.3, size = 5) +
  annotate("text", x = xb, y = yb, label = "B", 
          vjust = -1, hjust = -0.3, size = 5) +
  annotate("text", x = xc, y = yc, label = "C", 
          vjust = -1, hjust = 0.5, size = 5, color = "#FF0000") +
  # Linhas auxiliares
  geom_segment(aes(x = xa, xend = xa, y = 0, yend = ya),
              linetype = "dotted", color = "gray50") +
  geom_segment(aes(x = xb, xend = xb, y = 0, yend = yb),
              linetype = "dotted", color = "gray50") +
  # Anota√ß√£o do √¢ngulo
  annotate("text", x = 7.5, y = 8, label = "Œ±", 
          size = 6, color = "#FF0000") +
  annotate("text", x = 9.5, y = 22, 
          label = expression(paste("|tan", alpha, "| = ", 
                                  "|", frac(Delta*Y, Delta*X), "|")),
          size = 4, hjust = 0) +
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, 11), breaks = c(0, 5, 10)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 32), breaks = c(0, 10, 20, 30)) +
  labs(x = "Bem X", y = "Bem Y") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    axis.title = element_text(face = "bold")
  )
```
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: {.incremental}
- $\frac{\Delta Y}{\Delta X}$ √© a taxa de varia√ß√£o **m√©dia**: qual a varia√ß√£o em Y por unidade de varia√ß√£o em X

- $\left|\frac{\Delta Y}{\Delta X}\right|$ √© o **custo relativo** de uma unidade adicional de X

- $\left|\frac{\Delta Y}{\Delta X}\right|$ √© o **custo de oportunidade** de uma unidade adicional de X

- $\frac{dY}{dX}$ √© o declive da reta **tangente** no ponto C ‚Äî √© a **derivada** da FPP nesse ponto
:::
:::
::::

## Vantagens do Com√©rcio Internacional üåç

Admitamos que podemos aceder a um mercado internacional onde podemos transacionar bens aos pre√ßos de mercado.

::: {.incremental}
- A nossa **FPP n√£o muda** (capacidade produtiva mant√©m-se)
- Mas surgem novas **possibilidades de consumo**!
- Termos de troca: $\frac{p_x}{p_y}$ (quantas unidades de Y por cada unidade de X)
:::

::: {.fragment}
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 4

library(ggplot2)

x_smooth <- seq(0, 10, length.out = 100)
y_smooth <- 30 - (x_smooth^2)/3

# Linha de mercado (termos de troca = 0.8)
x_market <- seq(0, 37.5, length.out = 100)
y_market <- 30 - 0.8*x_market

df_fpp <- data.frame(x = x_smooth, y = y_smooth)
df_market <- data.frame(x = x_market, y = y_market)

ggplot() +
  geom_line(data = df_fpp, aes(x = x, y = y), 
           color = "#003D7A", size = 1.5) +
  geom_line(data = df_market, aes(x = x, y = y), 
           color = "#FF0000", size = 1.2, linetype = "solid") +
  annotate("text", x = 10, y = 30, label = "Y‚ÇÄ", 
          vjust = 1.5, hjust = -0.2, size = 4) +
  annotate("text", x = 10, y = 0, label = "X‚ÇÄ", 
          vjust = -0.8, size = 4) +
  annotate("text", x = 15, y = 20, label = "px/py", 
          color = "#FF0000", size = 5, angle = -25) +
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, 20), breaks = seq(0, 20, 5)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 35), breaks = seq(0, 30, 10)) +
  labs(x = "Bem X", y = "Bem Y",
       title = "Fronteira de Possibilidades de Consumo") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 13) +
  theme(
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    axis.title = element_text(face = "bold"),
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold", color = "#003D7A")
  )
```
:::

## Vantagens do Com√©rcio: Exemplo Num√©rico üìä {.smaller}

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| fig-width: 5
#| fig-height: 5

library(ggplot2)

x_smooth <- seq(0, 10, length.out = 100)
y_smooth <- 30 - (x_smooth^2)/3

# Ponto de produ√ß√£o E1
xe1 <- 5
ye1 <- 30 - (xe1^2)/3

# Linha de com√©rcio (declive = -1, passa por E1)
# y - ye1 = -1*(x - xe1)
x_trade <- seq(0, ye1 + xe1, length.out = 100)
y_trade <- ye1 - 1*(x_trade - xe1)

# Ponto de consumo E2
xe2 <- 10.83
ye2 <- ye1 - 1*(xe2 - xe1)

df_fpp <- data.frame(x = x_smooth, y = y_smooth)
df_trade <- data.frame(x = x_trade, y = y_trade)

ggplot() +
  geom_line(data = df_fpp, aes(x = x, y = y), 
           color = "#003D7A", size = 1.3) +
  geom_line(data = df_trade, aes(x = x, y = y), 
           color = "#FF0000", size = 1.2) +
  geom_point(aes(x = xe1, y = ye1), color = "#FF0000", size = 4) +
  geom_point(aes(x = xe2, y = ye2), color = "#FF0000", size = 4) +
  # Setas de exporta√ß√£o/importa√ß√£o
  geom_segment(aes(x = xe1, xend = xe1, y = ye1, yend = ye2),
              arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.25, "cm"), type = "closed"),
              color = "#FF6B35", size = 1.2) +
  geom_segment(aes(x = xe1, xend = xe2, y = ye2, yend = ye2),
              arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.25, "cm"), type = "closed"),
              color = "#FF6B35", size = 1.2) +
  # Labels
  annotate("text", x = xe1, y = ye1, label = "Produ√ß√£o", 
          vjust = -1, hjust = 1.1, size = 4) +
  annotate("text", x = xe2, y = ye2, label = "Consumo", 
          vjust = -1, hjust = -0.1, size = 4) +
  annotate("text", x = xe1 - 0.8, y = (ye1 + ye2)/2, label = "ŒîY\n(Export.)", 
          color = "#FF6B35", size = 3.5, fontface = "bold") +
  annotate("text", x = (xe1 + xe2)/2, y = ye2 - 1.5, label = "ŒîX (Import.)", 
          color = "#FF6B35", size = 3.5, fontface = "bold") +
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, 15), breaks = seq(0, 15, 5)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 32), breaks = seq(0, 30, 10)) +
  labs(x = "X (batatas - ton)", y = "Y (autom√≥veis)",
       title = "Exporta√ß√£o de Autom√≥veis") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    axis.title = element_text(face = "bold"),
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold")
  )
```
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Dados do mercado:**

::: {.incremental}
- 1 autom√≥vel vende-se por **‚Ç¨8.000** ($p_y$)
- 1 ton de batatas vende-se por **‚Ç¨1.000** ($p_x$)
- Termos de troca: 1 autom√≥vel = 8 ton de batatas

$$\frac{p_x}{p_y} = \frac{1.000}{8.000} = \frac{1}{8}$$

- Fronteira de consumo tem declive $\frac{1}{8}$ a partir do ponto de produ√ß√£o

- **Condi√ß√£o de equil√≠brio:**
$$\Delta Y \cdot p_y + \Delta X \cdot p_x = 0$$
:::
:::
::::
